tool_description: Access Yahoo Finance Realtime Stock Price |  Options | ESG | Trends | Statistics | Earnings | Balance Sheets | Analytics | Asset Profile and much more
name: Yahoo Finance
title: Yahoo Finance

api_list.name: key-statistics
api_list.description: The key statistics endpoint provides a summary of key financial statistics for a company. The endpoint returns the following data: market capitalization, enterprise value, trailing P/E ratio, forward P/E ratio, PEG ratio, price/sales (ttm), price/book (mrq), enterprise value/revenue (ttm), enterprise value/EBITDA (ttm)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com/key-statistics/aapl"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com/key-statistics/{ticker}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: ESG
api_list.description: Simply explained, an ESG score is a measure of a company's exposure to long-term environmental, social, and governance risks that are often overlooked during traditional financial analyses.

        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

api_list.name: finance-analytics
api_list.description:
This API endpoint also returns **AI recommendation**
Financial analysis refers to an assessment of the viability, stability, and profitability of a business, sub-business or project. It is performed by professionals who prepare reports using ratios and other techniques, that make use of information taken from financial statements and other reports.
api_list.code:

url = "https://yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com/finance-analytics/tsla"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Trend
api_list.description:
This reflects the insurance company's profits over given periods of time.
This endpoint also gives **experts** & **AI supported predictions** about stock future behavior

        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: earnings
api_list.description:
A company's earnings are its after-tax net income. This is the company's bottom line or its profits. Earnings are perhaps the single most important and most closely studied number in a company's financial statements.
This API **also** returns **historical earnings**
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com/earnings/tsla"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: historic-data
api_list.description:
return historic data
interval - The time interval between two data points. Can be 1m 2m 5m 15m 30m 60m 90m 1h 1d 5d 1wk 1mo 3mo
range - The range for which the data is returned.

for normal stocks :
you can directly search by tickername:
eg. tsla , msft , meta

for crypt:
try searching by ticker name followed by -USD.
for bitcoin try : btc-usd
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com/historic/tsla/1d/15d"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com/historic/{symbol}/{interval}/{range}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: balance-sheet
api_list.description: A **balance sheet** is a financial statement that communicates the so-called “book value” of an organization, as calculated by subtracting all of the company's liabilities and shareholder equity from its total assets.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com/balance-sheet/tsla"

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: price
api_list.description:
Returns the Stock Price Information for the symbol passed as parameter

for normal stocks :
you can directly search by tickername:
eg. tsla , msft , meta

for crypt:
try searching by ticker name followed by -USD.
for bitcoin try : btc-usd
for eth try : eth-usd
for dogecoin try : doge-usd
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com/price/eth-usd"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

api_list.name: multi-quote
api_list.description:
The multi-quote endpoint allows you to get multiple quotes with a single API call.
to use this feature, write the tickers separated by commas.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com/multi-quote/tsla,aapl,msft"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "yahoo-finance127.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
